alert.note: Alert for Corson; Dewey (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 12:23PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Corson and northwestern Dewey Counties through 100 PM MDT... At 1222 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Mclaughlin to near Glad Valley. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mahto around 1230 PM MDT. Little Eagle around 1235 PM MDT. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Aberdeen.
